case_title: Messrs GHARIBWAL CEMENT LIMITED and others vs RASHID SADIQ, EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR (ENFORCEMENT AND MONITORING), SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION OF PAKISTAN
court_name: Appellate Bench of Securities and Exchange Commission of Pakistan
appellant: Messrs GHARIBWAL CEMENT LIMITED and others
respondent: RASHID SADIQ, EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR (ENFORCEMENT AND MONITORING), SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION OF PAKISTAN
key_issues: Investments made in Dandot as an associated company of Gharibwal
Ratification by shareholders and its impact on section 208 violations
Nature of financial facilities provided by Gharibwal to Dandot
Losses suffered by Gharibwal due to investments in Dandot
Buy-back arrangement with Saudi-Pak Leasing and its compliance with section 208
Applicability of sections 195(5) and 488 of the Companies Ordinance, 1984

section_208.description: Investments made by Gharibwal in Dandot exceeded the 30% threshold without prior shareholder approval.
section_208.extent: Purchase of 966,500 shares for Rs 7.3 million and advances of Rs 337.8 million.

directions.auditor_certificate: Gharibwal must submit a certificate from its auditors confirming the actual amount to be brought back within 15 days.
directions.shortfall_recovery: Any shortfall indicated in the auditor's certificate must be recovered from Dandot within 30 days, failing which the directors will be held liable.

additional_notes.shareholder_approval: Subsequent ratification by shareholders does not validate unauthorized investments under section 208.
additional_notes.commercial_justifications: Commercial considerations cannot justify violations of mandatory legal provisions.
additional_notes.buy_back_arrangement: Buy-back arrangement with Saudi-Pak Leasing does not attract section 208 but may expose Gharibwal to financial loss.
